cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, then expected to curve north-north-east across Arkansas and the Ohio/Tennessee Valleys before exiting off the Mid-Atlantic coast late in the 5-day period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast (near Lake Charles, LA)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Not applicable – cyclone will be inland and well south of the Great Lakes by the time remnants reach latitude of Detroit

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, Louisiana; Storm Surge Watch stretches Freeport TX to Ocean Springs MS (far Gulf Coast – not Great Lakes)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of Texas and Louisiana with inland extension through Arkansas and lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds 20–30 mph possible as post-tropical remnants pass south of Detroit late Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Great Lakes port, no oceanic surge risk
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Saturday into Sunday, may cause brief ponding but significant flooding is unlikely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado potential over Ohio Valley could brush southern Michigan, but risk at the port is minimal
